text: well i think so the people
loved it and even those who were
suspicious of him at the start because
he was a catholic
found that he was not trying to advance
a
catholic church hierarchies agenda he
wasn't trying to
put public money into church schools the
way the bush so-called faith-based
initiatives
have done he wasn't
sending an ambassador to the vatican as
though it were a
state he was not uh
blocking
reproductive freedom
for women in fact he was the first
president ironic as the first catholic
president he was the first president to
support united nations
world population limitation programs
so
people got over those early suspicions
and they found that in one program after
another
whether it was the peace corps or the
space program aiming to go to the moon
or
his peaceful resolution of the crisis in
berlin and above all his ability to
persuade the soviets to withdraw their
nuclear missiles from cuba without the
united states firing a shot
yes the
i think people realized that was an
unusual
presidency and kennedy was an unusual
man
well that's uh hard to say because for
me it hasn't changed at all
there have been a lot there been a
thousand or more books uh
written about kennedy some of them have
been scurrilous based upon rumors about
his private life that had almost no
basis of fact
and what to what limited extent they had
a basis in fact
his uh
misconduct uh in his relations with
other women pale in comparison to
what we have seen in the white house the
sense
so i think that
on the whole people
realize and those old enough remember
that
the kennedy white house years were very
special years when americans of
all races religions
ages parties
could respect the united states could
look forward to presidential press
conferences we weren't just reading
about what the soviet union was doing we
were interested in reading what the
united states was doing the new kennedy
initiatives the new ideas that
poured forth a new agency for
disarmament and arms control
for example a new attack on the problems
of mental health and mental retardation
in this
country so
despite the revisionist
books there have also been a number of
other books some of them have gone
overboard the other way
camelot is a nice
story it's a nice myth and i suppose one
might say yes there was one brief
shining moment uh in our history and
that was the kennedy presidency
but camelot is about people who were
you know gods we weren't gods we had a
president who was
unusually dedicated committed
objective that he appointed a team
in the white house and the cabinet that
felt and acted as he did but we made
mistakes the bay of pigs was a huge
mistake and there were i'm sure
others all of this is going to be
reviewed in some frank detail in my book
my memoirs when they come out in may
